description: GitHub is a code hosting platform for version control and collaboration, offering Git-based repository management, issue tracking, and continuous integration features

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ACCEPT_A_REPOSITORY_INVITATION
capabilities.description: Accepts a PENDING repository invitation that has been issued to the authenticated user.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ACTIVITY_LIST_REPO_S_STARRED_BY_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: DEPRECATED: Lists repositories starred by the authenticated user, including star creation timestamps; use 'list_repositories_starred_by_the_authenticated_user' instead.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ACTIVITY_LIST_STARGAZERS_FOR_REPO
capabilities.description: DEPRECATED: Lists users who have starred a repository; use `list_stargazers` instead.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ACTIVITY_STAR_REPO_FOR_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: DEPRECATED: Stars a repository for the authenticated user; use `star_a_repository_for_the_authenticated_user` instead.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_AN_EMAIL_ADDRESS_FOR_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: Adds one or more email addresses (which will be initially unverified) to the authenticated user's GitHub account; use this to associate new emails, noting an email verified for another account will error, while an existing email for the current user is accepted.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_APP_ACCESS_RESTRICTIONS
capabilities.description: Replaces GitHub App access restrictions for an existing protected branch; requires a JSON array of app slugs in the request body, where apps must be installed and have 'contents' write permissions.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_A_REPOSITORY_COLLABORATOR
capabilities.description: Adds a GitHub user as a repository collaborator, or updates their permission if already a collaborator; `permission` applies to organization-owned repositories (personal ones default to 'push' and ignore this field), and an invitation may be created or permissions updated directly.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_A_REPOSITORY_TO_AN_APP_INSTALLATION
capabilities.description: Adds a repository to a GitHub App installation, granting the app access; requires authenticated user to have admin rights for the repository and access to the installation.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_A_SELECTED_REPOSITORY_TO_A_USER_SECRET
capabilities.description: Grants a specified repository access to an authenticated user's existing Codespaces secret, enabling Codespaces created for that repository to use the secret.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_ASSIGNEES_TO_AN_ISSUE
capabilities.description: Adds or removes assignees for a GitHub issue; changes are silently ignored if the authenticated user lacks push access to the repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_LABELS_TO_AN_ISSUE
capabilities.description: Adds labels (provided in the request body) to a repository issue; labels that do not already exist are created.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_ORG_RUNNER_LABELS
capabilities.description: Adds new custom labels to an existing self-hosted runner for an organization; existing labels are not removed, and duplicates are not added.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_OR_UPDATE_TEAM_MEMBERSHIP_FOR_A_USER
capabilities.description: Adds a GitHub user to a team or updates their role (member or maintainer), inviting them to the organization if not already a member; idempotent, returning current details if no change is made.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_OR_UPDATE_TEAM_PROJECT_PERMISSIONS
capabilities.description: Grants or updates a team's permissions ('read', 'write', or 'admin') for a specific project, which must exist within the specified organization and be linked to it.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_OR_UPDATE_TEAM_REPOSITORY_PERMISSIONS
capabilities.description: Sets or updates a team's permission level for a repository within an organization; the team must be a member of the organization.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_PROJECT_COLLABORATOR
capabilities.description: Adds a specified GitHub user as a collaborator to an existing organization project with a given permission level.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_REPO_TO_ORG_SECRET_WITH_SELECTED_ACCESS
capabilities.description: Adds a repository to an existing organization-level GitHub Actions secret that is configured for 'selected' repository access.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_REPO_TO_ORG_SECRET_WITH_SELECTED_VISIBILITY
capabilities.description: Grants an existing repository access to an existing organization-level Dependabot secret; the repository must belong to the organization, and the call succeeds without change if access already exists.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_RUNNER_LABELS
capabilities.description: Adds and appends custom labels to a self-hosted repository runner, which must be registered and active.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_SELECTED_REPOSITORY_TO_AN_ORGANIZATION_SECRET
capabilities.description: Adds a repository to an organization secret's access list when the secret's visibility is 'selected'; this operation is idempotent.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_SELECTED_REPOSITORY_TO_AN_ORGANIZATION_VARIABLE
capabilities.description: Grants a repository access to an organization-level GitHub Actions variable, if that variable's visibility is set to 'selected_repositories'.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_SOCIAL_ACCOUNTS_FOR_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: Adds one or more social media links (which must be valid, full URLs for platforms supported by GitHub) to the authenticated user's public GitHub profile.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_STATUS_CHECK_CONTEXTS
capabilities.description: Adds status check contexts (provided in the request body, e.g., `{"contexts": ["new-context"]}`) to a protected branch, requiring these contexts to have been previously reported.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_TEAM_ACCESS_RESTRICTIONS
capabilities.description: Overwrites the list of teams (and their child teams) granted push access to a protected branch; the list of team slugs must be provided in the HTTP POST request body.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_USER_ACCESS_RESTRICTIONS
capabilities.description: Sets/replaces list of users allowed to push to a protected branch; usernames (e.g., `["user1"]`) must be a JSON array in request body (not schema parameters), an empty array `[]` removes all restrictions. This action modifies the user access restrictions on a specific branch of a repository. Users specified in the request will be allowed to push to the branch, while an empty array will remove all restrictions.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ADD_USERS_TO_CODESPACES_ACCESS_FOR_AN_ORGANIZATION
capabilities.description: Sets or replaces the list of organization members granted Codespaces access billed to the organization; ensure the organization's billing settings allow access for selected members.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_API_ROOT
capabilities.description: Retrieves a map of all top-level GitHub REST API resource URLs and their templates.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_APPROVE_A_WORKFLOW_RUN_FOR_A_FORK_PULL_REQUEST
capabilities.description: Approves a workflow run from a forked repository's pull request; call this when such a run requires manual approval due to workflow configuration.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ASSIGN_AN_ORGANIZATION_ROLE_TO_A_TEAM
capabilities.description: Assigns an existing organization-level role (identified by `role_id`) to a team (identified by `team_slug`) within a GitHub organization (`org`), provided the organization, team, and role already exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_ASSIGN_AN_ORGANIZATION_ROLE_TO_A_USER
capabilities.description: Assigns a specific organization role to a user who is a member or an outside collaborator in a GitHub organization, using a valid role ID.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_AUTH_USER_DOCKER_CONFLICT_PACKAGES_LIST
capabilities.description: Lists Docker packages for the authenticated user that encountered conflicts during the Docker migration process.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_BLOCK_A_USER
capabilities.description: Blocks an existing individual GitHub user (not an organization or your own account), preventing them from interacting with your account and repositories.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_BLOCK_A_USER_FROM_AN_ORGANIZATION
capabilities.description: Blocks an existing GitHub user from an existing organization, preventing their contributions, collaboration, and forking of the organization's repositories.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CANCEL_A_GITHUB_PAGES_DEPLOYMENT
capabilities.description: Cancels an existing, ongoing or queued GitHub Pages deployment for a repository using its `pages_deployment_id`.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CANCEL_A_WORKFLOW_RUN
capabilities.description: Cancels a workflow run in a GitHub repository if it is in a cancellable state (e.g., 'in_progress' or 'queued').

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_A_TOKEN
capabilities.description: Checks if a GitHub App or OAuth access_token is valid for the specified client_id and retrieves its details, typically to verify its active status and grants.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_IF_A_GIST_IS_STARRED
capabilities.description: Checks if a Gist, identified by `gist_id`, is starred by the authenticated user, returning an empty response (204) if starred, or a 404 error if not starred or not found.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_IF_A_PERSON_IS_FOLLOWED_BY_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: Checks if the authenticated GitHub user follows a target GitHub user; an HTTP 204 status indicates the user is followed, while an HTTP 404 status indicates the user is not followed or the target user does not exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_IF_A_PULL_REQUEST_HAS_BEEN_MERGED
capabilities.description: Checks if a specified GitHub pull request has been merged, indicated by a 204 HTTP status (merged) or 404 (not merged/found).

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_IF_A_REPOSITORY_IS_STARRED_BY_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: DEPRECATED: Use `GITHUB_CHECK_IF_A_REPOSITORY_IS_STARRED_BY_THE_USER` instead.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_IF_A_USER_CAN_BE_ASSIGNED
capabilities.description: Verifies if a GitHub user can be assigned to issues in a repository; assignability is confirmed by an HTTP 204 (No Content) response, resulting in an empty 'data' field in the response.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_IF_A_USER_CAN_BE_ASSIGNED_TO_A_ISSUE
capabilities.description: Checks if a specified GitHub user can be assigned to a given issue within a repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_IF_A_USER_FOLLOWS_ANOTHER_USER
capabilities.description: Checks if a GitHub user `username` follows `target_user`; returns a 204 HTTP status if true, 404 if not or if users are invalid.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_IF_A_USER_IS_A_REPOSITORY_COLLABORATOR
capabilities.description: Checks if a user is a collaborator on a specified GitHub repository, returning a 204 status if they are, or a 404 status if they are not or if the repository/user does not exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_IF_A_USER_IS_BLOCKED_BY_AN_ORGANIZATION
capabilities.description: Checks if a GitHub user is blocked by an organization; a successful response (204 No Content) indicates the user IS blocked, while a 404 Not Found error indicates the user IS NOT blocked.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_IF_A_USER_IS_BLOCKED_BY_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: Checks if the specified GitHub user is blocked by the authenticated user; a 204 No Content response indicates the user is blocked, while a 404 Not Found indicates they are not.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_PRIVATE_VULNERABILITY_REPORTING_STATUS
capabilities.description: Checks if private vulnerability reporting is enabled for the specified repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_TEAM_PERMISSIONS_FOR_A_PROJECT
capabilities.description: Checks if a team has 'read', 'write', or 'admin' permissions for an organization's specific classic project, returning the project's details if access is confirmed.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CHECK_TEAM_PERMISSIONS_FOR_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Checks a team's permissions for a specific repository within an organization, including permissions inherited from parent teams.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CLEAR_REPOSITORY_CACHE_BY_KEY
capabilities.description: Deletes GitHub Actions caches from a repository matching a specific `key` and an optional Git `ref`, used to manage storage or clear outdated/corrupted caches; the action succeeds even if no matching caches are found to delete.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CLEAR_SELF_HOSTED_RUNNER_ORG_LABELS
capabilities.description: Removes all custom labels from a self-hosted runner for an organization; default labels (e.g., 'self-hosted', 'linux', 'x64') will remain.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_COMPARE_TWO_COMMITS
capabilities.description: Compares two commit points (commits, branches, tags, or SHAs) within a repository or across forks, using `BASE...HEAD` or `OWNER:REF...OWNER:REF` format for the `basehead` parameter.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CONFIGURE_JITRUNNER_FOR_ORG
capabilities.description: Generates a JIT configuration for a GitHub organization's new self-hosted runner to run a single job then unregister; the runner_group_id must exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CONFIGURE_OIDCSUBJECT_CLAIM_TEMPLATE
capabilities.description: Sets or updates the OIDC subject claim customization template for an existing GitHub organization by specifying which claims (e.g., 'repo', 'actor') form the OIDC token's subject (`sub`). This action customizes which claim keys are included in the OIDC subject claim for the specified organization. It allows for fine-tuning the content of the subject claim based on organizational needs.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CONVERT_AN_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER_TO_OUTSIDE_COLLABORATOR
capabilities.description: Converts an existing organization member, who is not an owner, to an outside collaborator, restricting their access to explicitly granted repositories.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_BLOB
capabilities.description: Creates a Git blob in a repository, requiring content and encoding ('utf-8' or 'base64').

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_CHECK_RUN
capabilities.description: Creates a new check run for a specific commit in a repository, used by external services to report status, detailed feedback, annotations, and images directly within the GitHub UI.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_CHECK_SUITE
capabilities.description: Creates a new check suite for a specific commit (`head_sha`) in an original repository (not a fork); GitHub dispatches a `check_suite` webhook event with the `requested` action upon success.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_CODESPACE_FOR_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: Creates a GitHub Codespace for the authenticated user, requiring a JSON request body with either `repository_id` (integer) or a `pull_request` object (containing `pull_request_number` (integer) and `repository_id` (integer)). This action allows users to set up a development environment quickly by creating a codespace from a specified repository or pull request.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_CODESPACE_FROM_A_PULL_REQUEST
capabilities.description: Creates a GitHub Codespace for an open pull request in a Codespaces-enabled repository, with options to customize its configuration.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_CODESPACE_IN_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Creates a GitHub Codespace for the authenticated user in a specified repository, which must be accessible and use a valid `devcontainer.json` if `devcontainer_path` is specified.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_COMMIT
capabilities.description: Creates a new commit in a GitHub repository; the `tree` SHA and any `parents` SHAs must already exist in the repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_COMMIT_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Creates a comment on a specific commit, or on a specific line if `path` and `position` are provided.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_COMMIT_STATUS
capabilities.description: Sets a commit's status (e.g., error, failure, pending, success from CI/CD) for a given SHA; max 1000 statuses per SHA/context.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_CUSTOM_ORGANIZATION_ROLE
capabilities.description: Creates a custom role with defined permissions within a GitHub organization.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_DEPLOY_KEY
capabilities.description: Creates a deploy key for a repository; the repository must exist and be accessible, and the provided key must be a valid public SSH key.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_DEPLOYMENT
capabilities.description: Creates a GitHub deployment for an existing repository, targeting a specific ref (branch, tag, or SHA) that must also exist within the repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_DEPLOYMENT_BRANCH_POLICY
capabilities.description: Creates a deployment branch or tag policy for an existing environment in a GitHub repository, using a Ruby File.fnmatch pattern (where `*` doesn't match `/`) to specify which branches or tags are deployable.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_DEPLOYMENT_STATUS
capabilities.description: Creates a status for an existing deployment, updating its operational state, associated URLs, and description.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_DISCUSSION
capabilities.description: Creates a new discussion post on a specific team's page within an organization.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_DISCUSSION_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Creates a new comment on an existing team discussion within a GitHub organization.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_FORK
capabilities.description: Creates a fork of an accessible repository, optionally into a specific organization, with a new name, or copying only the default branch.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_GIST
capabilities.description: Creates a new gist on GitHub with provided files, an optional description, and public/secret visibility.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_GIST_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Creates a new comment on a specified GitHub gist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_GITHUB_APP_FROM_A_MANIFEST
capabilities.description: Use this action to finalize a GitHub App's creation by exchanging the temporary `code` (received as a URL parameter during the app manifest setup redirection) for the app's full configuration details.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_GITHUB_PAGES_DEPLOYMENT
capabilities.description: Creates a GitHub Pages deployment for a repository using a specified artifact and OIDC token, provided GitHub Pages is enabled and the artifact (containing static assets) is accessible.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_GITHUB_PAGES_SITE
capabilities.description: Configures or updates GitHub Pages for a repository, setting build type and source; ensure a Pages workflow exists for 'workflow' `build_type`, or `source_branch` exists for 'legacy' or unspecified `build_type`. This action allows users to effectively manage their GitHub Pages site settings, specifying how the site is built and where the source files are located.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_LABEL
capabilities.description: Creates a new label in a specified GitHub repository, provided the repository exists and the user has write permissions.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_MILESTONE
capabilities.description: Creates a milestone in a GitHub repository for tracking progress on issues or pull requests; requires repository existence and user write permissions.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_AN_AUTOLINK_REFERENCE_FOR_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Creates a repository autolink to automatically convert text references (e.g., 'TICKET-123') into hyperlinks, using a unique `key_prefix` and a `url_template` that includes `<num>`.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_AN_ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
capabilities.description: Creates an encrypted environment variable for a pre-existing environment within a GitHub repository; will fail if the variable name already exists.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_AN_ISSUE
capabilities.description: Creates a new issue in a GitHub repository, requiring the repository to exist and have issues enabled; specific fields like assignees, milestone, or labels may require push access.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_AN_ISSUE_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Creates a new comment on an existing GitHub issue or pull request within the specified repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_AN_ORGANIZATION_PROJECT
capabilities.description: Creates a new classic project board within a specified GitHub organization.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_AN_ORGANIZATION_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Creates a new repository within a specified GitHub organization, with options for detailed configuration including visibility, features, merge strategies, initial commit, and templates.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_AN_ORGANIZATION_VARIABLE
capabilities.description: Creates a new, uniquely named GitHub Actions variable for an organization, with configurable repository access visibility (all, private, or selected).

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_AN_ORGANIZATION_WEBHOOK
capabilities.description: Creates a webhook for a GitHub organization to deliver event notifications to a configured URL.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_PROJECT_CARD
capabilities.description: Creates a project card in a GitHub project column; the request body must contain either a `note` for a note-only card, or both `content_id` (ID of an issue or pull request) and `content_type` (e.g., 'Issue', 'PullRequest'). This action facilitates the organization of tasks and issues in a project management context within GitHub.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_PROJECT_COLUMN
capabilities.description: Creates a new column in a GitHub project (classic).

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_PULL_REQUEST
capabilities.description: Creates a pull request in a GitHub repository, requiring existing `base` and `head` branches; `title` or `issue` must be provided.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REFERENCE
capabilities.description: Creates a Git reference (e.g., a branch or tag) in a repository; the repository must not be empty prior to this operation.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REGISTRATION_TOKEN_FOR_AN_ORGANIZATION
capabilities.description: Generates a temporary (one-hour) registration token to add a new self-hosted runner to an organization for GitHub Actions.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REGISTRATION_TOKEN_FOR_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Generates a time-limited token required to register a new self-hosted runner with a specific repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_RELEASE
capabilities.description: Creates a release in a GitHub repository for a specified tag; the tag must be unique for published releases, and if a `discussion_category_name` is given, it must already exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REMOVE_TOKEN_FOR_AN_ORGANIZATION
capabilities.description: Generates a token, valid for one hour, to authenticate removing a self-hosted runner from an organization.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REMOVE_TOKEN_FOR_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Generates a temporary (one-hour validity) token required to unregister and remove a self-hosted runner from a repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REPLY_FOR_A_REVIEW_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Posts a reply to a specific review comment on a GitHub pull request, requiring the repository, pull request, and original comment to exist, and a non-empty reply body.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REPOSITORY_DISPATCH_EVENT
capabilities.description: Triggers a GitHub Actions workflow or a webhook on a repository by creating a repository dispatch event, allowing programmatic triggering of workflows based on events outside of GitHub.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REPOSITORY_FOR_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: Creates a new repository for the authenticated user, optionally within an organization if `team_id` is specified.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REPOSITORY_FROM_AN_UNPUBLISHED_CODESPACE
capabilities.description: Publishes the specified codespace to a new repository, using the codespace's current state as the initial commit.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REPOSITORY_PROJECT
capabilities.description: Creates a new classic project board within a specified repository; classic projects must be enabled for the target repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REPOSITORY_RULESET
capabilities.description: Creates a uniquely named ruleset for a repository, defining rules for branches or tags with specified enforcement, conditions, and bypass actors.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REPOSITORY_USING_A_TEMPLATE
capabilities.description: Creates a new repository from an existing template repository; the authenticated user must have access to the template and, if creating in an organization, repository creation permissions within it.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REPOSITORY_VARIABLE
capabilities.description: Creates a new, unencrypted variable in a repository for GitHub Actions workflows; fails if a variable with the same name already exists.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REPOSITORY_WEBHOOK
capabilities.description: Creates a webhook for a specified repository; requires admin permissions on the repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REVIEW_COMMENT_FOR_A_PULL_REQUEST
capabilities.description: Creates a review comment on a pull request's diff, targeting a specific line, range of lines, an entire file, or replying to an existing comment.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_REVIEW_FOR_A_PULL_REQUEST
capabilities.description: Creates a pull request review, allowing approval, change requests, or comments; `body` is required if `event` is `REQUEST_CHANGES` or `COMMENT`, and omitting `event` makes the review `PENDING`.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_SCOPED_ACCESS_TOKEN
capabilities.description: Exchanges a user-to-server token for a new, fine-grained scoped access token for a GitHub App, requiring `client_id`, `access_token`, either `target` or `target_id`, and at least one permission; for repository-specific scoping, provide either `repositories` (names) or `repository_ids` (IDs), but not both.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_SNAPSHOT_OF_DEPENDENCIES_FOR_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Creates a snapshot of a repository's dependencies to populate the GitHub dependency graph and enable security alerts; `sha` must be a 40-character commit ID, `ref` a fully qualified Git reference (e.g., `refs/heads/main`), and `scanned` an ISO 8601 timestamp.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_TAG_OBJECT
capabilities.description: Creates an annotated Git tag object in a repository, pointing to an existing Git object (commit, tree, or blob) defined by its SHA and ensuring the `type` field correctly specifies the object's type.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_TAG_PROTECTION_STATE_FOR_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Creates a tag protection rule for a repository using a glob pattern; note: tag protections are deprecated (sunset August 30, 2024), migrate to repository rulesets.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_TEAM
capabilities.description: Creates a new team in an organization, optionally with maintainers, repositories, specific privacy, notification settings, or a parent team; if `parent_team_id` is given, `privacy` must be 'closed'.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_TEMPORARY_PRIVATE_FORK
capabilities.description: Creates a temporary private fork of the specified repository to address a security vulnerability, linking the fork to a GHSA ID that must be specifically associated with this repository; the fork may take up to 5 minutes to become accessible.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_TREE
capabilities.description: Creates a new Git tree object in a repository, defining file/directory structure by specifying tree entries, optionally building on a `base_tree` SHA; all provided SHAs must be valid.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_USER_PROJECT
capabilities.description: Creates a new GitHub project board for the authenticated user to organize and track issues, pull requests, and notes.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_A_WORKFLOW_DISPATCH_EVENT
capabilities.description: Manually triggers a GitHub Actions workflow identified by `workflow_id` at a given `ref`, if the workflow is configured to accept `workflow_dispatch` events.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_COMMIT_SIGNATURE_PROTECTION
capabilities.description: Enables commit signature protection for a specified branch, requiring all new commits to be signed.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_DEPLOYMENT_PROTECTION_RULE
capabilities.description: Enables a custom deployment protection rule for an existing environment in a repository by linking a configured GitHub App (via `integration_id`) to control deployments.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_JIT_RUNNER_CONFIG
capabilities.description: Generates a temporary Just-In-Time (JIT) configuration for a new self-hosted GitHub Actions runner for a repository; any specified non-default `runner_group_id` must be an existing runner group accessible by the repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_OR_UPDATE_A_CUSTOM_PROPERTY_FOR_AN_ORGANIZATION
capabilities.description: Creates a new custom property (name must be unique for creation) or updates an existing one for an organization to define metadata for its repositories.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_OR_UPDATE_AN_ENVIRONMENT
capabilities.description: Creates a new environment or updates an existing one in a GitHub repository, allowing configuration of deployment protection rules such as wait timers and reviewers; ensure `environment_name` is URL-encoded if it contains special characters.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_OR_UPDATE_AN_ENVIRONMENT_SECRET
capabilities.description: Creates or updates an environment secret with an `encrypted_value` that was encrypted using the public key identified by `key_id` for the specified environment.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_OR_UPDATE_AN_ORGANIZATION_SECRET
capabilities.description: Creates or updates an organization secret for GitHub Actions, requiring its value to be pre-encrypted via LibSodium using the organization's public key.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_OR_UPDATE_A_REPOSITORY_SECRET
capabilities.description: Creates or updates a GitHub Actions secret within a specific repository; use `encrypted_value` and `key_id` to set or change its value.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_OR_UPDATE_A_SECRET_FOR_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: Creates or updates a Codespaces secret for the authenticated user; `encrypted_value` must be encrypted with the public key (ID: `key_id`) from GitHub's 'Get public key for the authenticated user' endpoint.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_OR_UPDATE_CUSTOM_PROPERTIES_FOR_AN_ORGANIZATION
capabilities.description: Creates new custom property schemas or updates existing ones in bulk for a specified organization; each property definition must include `property_name` and `value_type`.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_OR_UPDATE_CUSTOM_PROPERTY_VALUES_FOR_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Creates or updates up to 30 custom property values for a repository; custom properties must be predefined at the organization or repository level, and setting a property's value to `null` removes it.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_OR_UPDATE_FILE_CONTENTS
capabilities.description: Creates a new file or updates an existing file in a GitHub repository; SHA can be provided to validate file updates, automatically fetched if not provided.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_OR_UPDATE_REPO_SECRET_WITH_ENCRYPTED_VALUE
capabilities.description: Creates or updates a Dependabot secret in a repository using an `encrypted_value` (pre-encrypted with LibSodium using the repository's Dependabot public key) and its corresponding `key_id`. This action allows you to securely manage secrets for a given repository, ensuring that sensitive data remains protected during the update process. By providing the encrypted value alongside the key ID, you can seamlessly maintain the necessary credentials for your repository's operations.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_REACTION_FOR_A_COMMIT_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Creates an emoji reaction for a commit comment; if the user has already reacted with the same content, details of the existing reaction are returned.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_REACTION_FOR_AN_ISSUE
capabilities.description: Creates a reaction for a specified issue within a GitHub repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_REACTION_FOR_AN_ISSUE_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Creates a reaction for a specific comment on an issue within a GitHub repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_REACTION_FOR_A_PULL_REQUEST_REVIEW_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Adds a specified reaction to a pull request review comment within a GitHub repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_REACTION_FOR_A_RELEASE
capabilities.description: Creates an emoji reaction for a specific, existing release in a GitHub repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_REACTION_FOR_A_TEAM_DISCUSSION
capabilities.description: Creates a reaction for a team discussion within a GitHub organization.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_REACTION_FOR_A_TEAM_DISCUSSION_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Adds a reaction to a team discussion comment, requiring the specified organization, team, discussion, and comment to exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CREATE_UPDATE_ORG_SECRET_WITH_LIB_SODIUM
capabilities.description: Creates or updates a Dependabot organization secret, requiring the secret value to be pre-encrypted with LibSodium using the organization's public key obtained from the 'Get an organization public key' endpoint.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CUSTOMIZE_OIDC_SUBJECT_CLAIM_TEMPLATE
capabilities.description: Retrieves the OpenID Connect (OIDC) subject claim customization template for a repository, which defines the `sub` claim structure in OIDC tokens for GitHub Actions workflows; returns the default configuration if no customization is applied.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CUSTOM_OIDCSUBJECT_CLAIM_TEMPLATE
capabilities.description: Retrieves the OpenID Connect (OIDC) subject claim customization template for a GitHub organization, which defines how the `sub` claim in OIDC tokens for workflows is constructed.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_CUSTOM_OIDCSUBJECT_CLAIM_TEMPLATE_SETTER
capabilities.description: Sets the OpenID Connect (OIDC) subject claim template for a GitHub repository, allowing use of the default template or a custom one defined by `include_claim_keys` if `use_default` is `false`.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DECLINE_A_REPOSITORY_INVITATION
capabilities.description: Declines a specific, pending repository invitation for the authenticated user, identified by its `invitation_id`.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_ACCESS_RESTRICTIONS
capabilities.description: Removes all user, team, and app-based access restrictions from a protected branch.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_CODE_SCANNING_ANALYSIS_FROM_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific code scanning analysis by its ID from a repository; `confirm_delete` must be `true` if it's the last analysis of its type for a given tool and reference to prevent data loss.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_CODESPACE_FOR_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific codespace owned by the authenticated user; this is a destructive action and the codespace must exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_CODESPACE_FROM_THE_ORGANIZATION
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a specific codespace belonging to a member of the specified organization.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_COMMIT_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific commit comment, identified by its `comment_id`, from the specified repository; the comment must exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_COMMIT_COMMENT_REACTION
capabilities.description: Deletes a reaction from a commit comment in a GitHub repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_CUSTOM_ORGANIZATION_ROLE
capabilities.description: Deletes a custom organization role (which should not be actively assigned) by its ID; a 204 No Content response indicates success.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_DEPLOY_KEY
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific deploy key from a repository; to change a key's properties or access scope, the existing key must be deleted and a new one created.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_DEPLOYMENT
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a specified *inactive* deployment from a repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_DEPLOYMENT_BRANCH_POLICY
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific deployment branch or tag policy, identified by its ID, from a given environment within a repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_DISCUSSION
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific team discussion, identified by its number, from an organization's team.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_DISCUSSION_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific comment from an existing team discussion within an organization, provided the specified organization, team, discussion, and comment all exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_ADMIN_BRANCH_PROTECTION
capabilities.description: Removes admin enforcement from a protected branch (branch name cannot contain wildcard characters) in a repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_FILE
capabilities.description: Deletes a file by path from a GitHub repository, requiring a commit message and the file's current blob SHA to confirm the deletion.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_GIST
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes an existing GitHub gist, specified by its `gist_id`; this action is destructive and cannot be undone.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_GIST_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific comment from a GitHub Gist using its `gist_id` and `comment_id`.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_GITHUB_PAGES_SITE
capabilities.description: Deletes the GitHub Pages site for the specified repository; completes without error if no site is currently enabled.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_LABEL
capabilities.description: Permanently removes an existing label from a repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_MILESTONE
capabilities.description: Deletes the specified milestone if it exists; this operation is idempotent, typically returning a 404 if the milestone is not found or already deleted.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_APP_AUTHORIZATION
capabilities.description: Revokes a single, specific OAuth access token for an OAuth App, not all authorizations for the app.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_APP_TOKEN
capabilities.description: Revokes an OAuth access token for a GitHub App, if the app exists and the token was issued to it.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_ARTIFACT
capabilities.description: Deletes a GitHub artifact by its ID within a repository, typically resulting in an empty response (HTTP 204 No Content) on success.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_AUTOLINK_REFERENCE_FROM_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific autolink reference (which automatically links external resource IDs like JIRA-123 to URLs) from the specified repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_EMAIL_ADDRESS_FOR_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: Sends an empty request body to `DELETE /user/emails` to attempt deletion of user email addresses; the API typically requires specific emails, so outcome may vary.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_ENVIRONMENT
capabilities.description: Deletes an existing deployment environment from an existing repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_ENVIRONMENT_SECRET
capabilities.description: Deletes an existing and accessible secret from a specified environment within a GitHub repository, returning an empty dictionary on success or error details otherwise.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
capabilities.description: Deletes a named environment variable from a specified, existing environment within a GitHub repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_ISSUE_COMMENT
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a specific comment by its ID from an issue or pull request, if the repository exists and the comment ID is valid.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_ISSUE_COMMENT_REACTION
capabilities.description: Deletes a reaction from an issue comment in a repository; the repository, comment, and reaction must exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_ISSUE_REACTION
capabilities.description: Permanently removes a specific reaction from an issue in a GitHub repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_ORGANIZATION
capabilities.description: Deletes a GitHub organization and its repositories; this is a destructive action and the organization name will be unavailable for reuse for approximately 90 days.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_ORGANIZATION_SECRET
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a secret from a GitHub organization, making it inaccessible to GitHub Actions workflows or other tools.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_ORGANIZATION_VARIABLE
capabilities.description: Deletes a named GitHub Actions variable from a specified organization.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_AN_ORGANIZATION_WEBHOOK
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific webhook, identified by `hook_id`, from an existing organization.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_PACKAGE_FOR_AN_ORGANIZATION
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific package in an organization; cannot delete public packages with over 5,000 downloads.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_PACKAGE_FOR_A_USER
capabilities.description: Deletes a package owned by the specified user, requiring admin permissions for the authenticated user; deletion of public packages with over 5,000 downloads may require GitHub support.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_PACKAGE_FOR_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a specific package owned by the authenticated user; public packages downloaded over 5,000 times cannot be deleted via this API.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_PACKAGE_VERSION_FOR_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: Deletes an existing package version associated with the authenticated user.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_PENDING_REVIEW_FOR_A_PULL_REQUEST
capabilities.description: Deletes a pending (unsubmitted) review from a pull request; this is only possible if the review has not yet been submitted.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_PROJECT
capabilities.description: Deletes the GitHub project specified by `project_id` if the project exists and the projects feature is enabled for its repository or organization; a successful deletion results in a 204 No Content response.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_PROJECT_CARD
capabilities.description: Deletes a project card from a GitHub 'Project (classic)'; this operation is idempotent.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_PROJECT_COLUMN
capabilities.description: Deletes a project column by its ID from a GitHub project (classic); this is a destructive operation.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_PULL_REQUEST_COMMENT_REACTION
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific reaction from a pull request review comment, provided the comment and reaction exist on that comment within the specified repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_REFERENCE
capabilities.description: Deletes a Git reference from a repository; 'ref' must be fully qualified (e.g., 'refs/heads/branch' or 'refs/tags/tag').

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_RELEASE
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a specific release, its assets, and potentially its associated Git tag from a repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_RELEASE_ASSET
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific release asset from a GitHub repository; this action is idempotent.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_RELEASE_REACTION
capabilities.description: Deletes a reaction from a GitHub release, provided the repository, release, and reaction exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes the specified repository; this is a destructive, irreversible action that requires admin privileges for the repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_REPOSITORY_INVITATION
capabilities.description: Deletes an active repository invitation, permanently revoking a user's access to collaborate on the specified repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_REPOSITORY_RULESET
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a repository ruleset.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_REPOSITORY_SECRET
capabilities.description: Deletes a named GitHub Actions secret from a specified repository; this operation is destructive and idempotent, and requires the repository to exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_REPOSITORY_SUBSCRIPTION
capabilities.description: Deletes the authenticated user's subscription to a specified repository if it exists, effectively 'unwatching' it.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_REPOSITORY_VARIABLE
capabilities.description: Deletes a named variable (e.g., for GitHub Actions workflows) from a repository; the repository and the variable must already exist.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_REPOSITORY_WEBHOOK
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific webhook from a repository.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_REVIEW_COMMENT_FOR_A_PULL_REQUEST
capabilities.description: Deletes a specific pull request review comment.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_SECRET_FOR_THE_AUTHENTICATED_USER
capabilities.description: Deletes an existing Codespaces secret for the authenticated user by `secret_name`; this is a destructive, irreversible, and idempotent operation.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_SELF_HOSTED_RUNNER_FROM_AN_ORGANIZATION
capabilities.description: Deletes an existing and registered self-hosted runner from an organization, typically returning 204 No Content on success.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_SELF_HOSTED_RUNNER_FROM_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Removes a specific self-hosted runner (by `runner_id`) from a repository, if registered there; this is idempotent.

capabilities.name: GITHUB_DELETE_A_TAG_PROTECTION_STATE_FOR_A_REPOSITORY
capabilities.description: Permanently deletes a specific tag protection rule, identified by its ID, from the given repository.
